<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Cash interest payments in 2016 were $73&nbsp;million (2015 &#150; $74&nbsp;million, 2014 &#150; $82 million). The weighted average interest rate on short-term borrowings in 2016 was 0.8&nbsp;percent (2015 &#150;
	0.8&nbsp;percent, 2014 &#150; 1.1 percent). Average effective rate on the long-term borrowings with ExxonMobil in 2016 was 1.0&nbsp;percent (2015 - 1.0&nbsp;percent, 2014 - 1.2 percent).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2016, the company had borrowed $75&nbsp;million under an arrangement with an affiliated company of ExxonMobil that provides for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-interest
</FONT>
	bearing, revolving demand loan from ExxonMobil to the company of up to $75&nbsp;million. The loan represents ExxonMobil&#146;s share of a working capital facility required to support purchasing,
	marketing and transportation arrangements for crude oil and diluent products undertaken by Imperial on behalf of ExxonMobil.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In October 2016, the company decreased
	the amount of its unused committed long-term line of credit from $500&nbsp;million to $250&nbsp;million and extended the maturity date to November 2018. In December 2016, the company decreased the amount of its unused committed short-term line of
	credit from $500&nbsp;million to $250&nbsp;million and extended the maturity date to December 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_82">
</A>
	13. Leased facilities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2016, the company held
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cancelable
</FONT>
	operating leases covering primarily storage tanks, rail cars and
	marine vessels, with minimum undiscounted lease commitments totaling $275&nbsp;million as indicated in the following table:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Borrowed under an existing agreement with an affiliated company of ExxonMobil that provides for a long-term, variable-rate loan from ExxonMobil to the company of up to $7.75&nbsp;billion at interest equivalent to
	Canadian market rates. The agreement is effective until July&nbsp;31, 2020, cancelable if ExxonMobil provides at least 370 days advance written notice.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Capital leases are primarily associated with transportation facilities and services agreements. The average imputed rate was 6.9&nbsp;percent in 2016 (2015 &#150; 5.8 percent). Total capitalized lease obligations also
	include $27&nbsp;million in current liabilities (2015 - $28 million). Principal payments on capital leases of approximately $25&nbsp;million per year are due in each of the next four years after December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	During 2016, the company decreased its long-term debt by $1,505&nbsp;million by partially repaying an existing facility with an affiliated company of ExxonMobil.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_84">
</A>
	15. Accounting for suspended exploratory well costs
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The company continues capitalization of exploratory well costs when the well has found a sufficient quantity of reserves to justify its completion as a producing well
	and the company is making sufficient progress assessing the reserves and the economic and operating viability of the project. The term &#147;project&#148; as used in this report can refer to a variety of different activities and does not necessarily
	have the same meaning as in any government payment transparency reports.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following two tables provide details of the changes in the balance of suspended
	exploratory well costs as well as an aging summary of those costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Change in capitalized suspended exploratory well costs:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Exploration activity on the Horn River project with suspended well costs has been completed and the company continues to evaluate

</P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_85">
</A>
	16. Transactions with related parties
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Revenues and expenses of the company also include the results of transactions with affiliated companies of ExxonMobil in the normal course of operations. These were
	conducted on terms comparable to those which would have been conducted with unrelated parties and primarily consisted of the purchase and sale of crude oil, natural gas, petroleum and chemical products, as well as technical, engineering and research
	and development costs. Transactions with ExxonMobil also included amounts paid and received in connection with the company&#146;s participation in a number of upstream activities conducted jointly in Canada.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In addition, the company has existing agreements with ExxonMobil to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Provide computer and customer support services to the company and to share common business and operational support services that allow the companies to consolidate duplicate work and systems;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Operate certain western Canada production properties owned by ExxonMobil as well as provide for the delivery of management, business and technical services to ExxonMobil in Canada. These agreements are designed to
	provide organizational efficiencies and to reduce costs. No separate legal entities were created from these arrangements. Separate books of account continue to be maintained for the company and ExxonMobil. The company and ExxonMobil retain ownership
	of their respective assets, and there is no impact on operations or reserves;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Provide for the delivery of management, business and technical services to Syncrude Canada Ltd. by ExxonMobil; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Provide for the option of equal participation in new upstream opportunities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Certain charges from ExxonMobil have been
	capitalized; they are not material in the aggregate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The amounts of purchases and sales by Imperial in 2016, with ExxonMobil, were $2,187&nbsp;million and
	$2,315&nbsp;million respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As at December&nbsp;31, 2016, the company had outstanding long-term loans of $4,447&nbsp;million (2015 &#150; $5,952 million) and
	short-term loans of $75&nbsp;million (2015 &#150; $75 million) from ExxonMobil (see note 14, long-term debt, on page 77 and note&nbsp;12, financing costs and additional notes and loans payable information, on page 76 for further details).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Imperial has other related party transactions not detailed in note 16, as they are not significant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	79
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>

<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_87">
</A>
	Supplemental information on oil and gas exploration and production activities
</B>
	(unaudited)
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The information on pages 81 to 82 excludes items not related to oil and natural gas extraction, such as administrative and general expenses,
	pipeline operations, gas plant processing fees and gains or losses on asset sales. The company&#146;s 25&nbsp;percent interest in proved synthetic oil reserves in the Syncrude joint-venture is included as part of the company&#146;s total proved oil
	and gas reserves and in the calculation of the standardized measure of discounted future cash flows, in accordance with U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and U.S. Financial Accounting Standards Board rules. Results of operations, costs
	incurred in property acquisitions, exploration and development activities, and capitalized costs include the company&#146;s share of Syncrude, Kearl and other unproved mineable acreages in the following tables.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The amounts reported as costs incurred in property acquisitions, exploration and development activities include both capitalized costs
	and costs charged to expense during the year. Costs incurred also include new asset retirement obligations established in the current year, as well as increases or decreases to the asset retirement obligation resulting from changes in cost estimates
	or abandonment date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

</TD>

	Sales to customers or intersegment sales do not include the sale of natural gas and natural gas liquids purchased for resale, as well as royalty payments. These items are reported gross in note 2 in &#147;operating
	revenues&#148;, &#147;intersegment sales&#148; and in &#147;purchases of crude oil and products&#148;.
</TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Sales of crude oil to consolidated affiliates are at market value, using posted field prices. Sales of natural gas liquids to consolidated affiliates are at prices estimated to be obtainable in a competitive,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	arm&#146;s-length
</FONT>
	transaction.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#147;Property costs&#148; are payments for rights to explore for petroleum and natural gas and for purchased reserves (acquired tangible and intangible assets such as gas plants, production facilities and
	producing-well costs are included under &#147;producing assets&#148;). &#147;Proved&#148; represents areas where successful drilling has delineated a field capable of production. &#147;Unproved&#148; represents all other areas.
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Standardized measure of discounted future cash flows
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As required by the U.S.
	Financial Accounting Standards Board, the standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows is computed by applying
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	first-day-of-the-month
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
	average prices,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	costs and legislated tax rates and a discount factor of 10&nbsp;percent to net proved reserves. The
	standardized measure includes costs for future dismantlement, abandonment and remediation obligations. The company believes the standardized measure does not provide a reliable estimate of the company&#146;s expected future cash flows to be obtained
	from the development and production of its oil and gas properties or of the value of its proved oil and gas reserves. The standardized measure is prepared on the basis of certain prescribed assumptions, including
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	first-day-of-the-month
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
	average prices, which represent discrete points in time and therefore may cause significant variability
	in cash flows from year to year as prices change.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows related to proved oil and gas reserves
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="93%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

	&nbsp;

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(a) SEC rules require the company&#146;s reserves to be calculated on the basis of average
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	first-of-month
</FONT>
</FONT>
	oil and natural gas prices during the reporting year. As a result of low prices during 2016, under the SEC definition of proved reserves, certain quantities of bitumen that qualified as proved
	reserves in prior years did not qualify as proved reserves at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	2016. Future net cash flows for these quantities are excluded from the 2016 &#147;Standardized measure of discounted future cash
	flows&#148;. Substantially all of this reduction in discounted future net cash flows since December&nbsp;31, 2015 is reflected in the line &#147;Net change in prices, development costs and production costs&#148;, in the table above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	82
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage83"></A>

<B>
	Net proved reserves
</B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Net reserves are the company&#146;s share of reserves after deducting the shares of mineral owners or governments or both. All reported reserves are located in Canada. Reserves of natural gas are calculated at a
	pressure of 14.73 pounds per square inch at 60&deg;F.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Liquids include crude, condensate and natural gas liquids (NGLs). NGL proved reserves are not material and are therefore included under liquids.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Gas converted to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	oil-equivalent
</FONT>
	at six million cubic feet per one thousand barrels.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The information above describes changes during the years and balances of proved oil and gas reserves at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	2014, 2015 and
	2016. The definitions used are in accordance with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission&#146;s
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Rule&nbsp;4-10
</FONT>
	(a) of Regulation
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	S-X.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Proved oil and natural gas reserves are those quantities of oil and gas, which, by analysis of geoscience and engineering data, can be estimated with reasonable
	certainty to be economically producible &#150; from a given date forward, from known reservoirs, and under existing economic conditions, operating methods and government regulations &#150; prior to the time at which contracts providing the right to
	operate expire. In some cases, substantial new investments in additional wells and other facilities will be required to recover these proved reserves.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In
	accordance with SEC rules, the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	reserves volumes as well as the reserves change categories shown in the proved reserves tables are required to be calculated on the basis of average prices during the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period prior to the ending date of the period covered by the report, determined as an unweighted
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	83
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage84"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	arithmetic average of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	first-day-of-the-month
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
	price for each month within such period. These reserves quantities
	were also used in calculating
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	unit-of-production
</FONT>
</FONT>
	depreciation rates and in calculating the standardized measure of discounted net cash flow.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Revisions can include upward or downward changes in previously estimated volumes of proved reserves for existing fields due to the evaluation or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-evaluation
</FONT>
	of already available geologic, reservoir or production data; new geologic, reservoir or production data; or changes in the average of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	first-of-month
</FONT>
</FONT>
	oil and natural gas prices and / or costs that are used in the estimation of reserves. Revisions can result from significant changes in either development
	strategy or production equipment / facility capacity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2014, upward revisions of proved developed and undeveloped bitumen reserves were primarily associated with
	the conclusion of technical studies supporting lengthening of the expected useful life of Kearl operating assets under routine maintenance and sustaining capital conditions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 2015, upward revisions of proved developed bitumen reserves were associated with migration of the Kearl expansion project from proved undeveloped, and improved
	performance demonstrated at Kearl. As well, upward revision to bitumen and synthetic oil were associated with lower royalty obligations driven by lower pricing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In
	2016, downward revisions of proved developed and undeveloped bitumen reserves were a result of low prices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As a result of low prices during 2016, under the U.S.
	Securities and Exchange Commission definition of proved reserves, certain quantities of bitumen that qualified as proved reserves in prior years did not qualify as proved reserves at
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	year-end
</FONT>
	2016. Amounts no
	longer qualifying as proved reserves include the entire 2.5&nbsp;billion barrels of bitumen at Kearl and approximately 0.2&nbsp;billion barrels of bitumen at Cold Lake. Among the factors that would result in these amounts being recognized again as
	proved reserves at some point in the future are a recovery in average price levels, a further decline in costs, and / or operating efficiencies. Under the terms of certain contractual arrangements or government royalty regimes, lower prices can also
	increase proved reserves attributable to Imperial. The company does not expect the downward revision of reported proved reserves under the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission definitions to affect the operation of the underlying projects or to
	alter its outlook for future production volumes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net proved reserves are determined by deducting the estimated future share of mineral owners or governments or
	both. For liquids and natural gas, net proved reserves are based on estimated future royalty rates as of the date the estimate is made incorporating the applicable governments&#146; oil and gas royalty regimes. For bitumen, net proved reserves are
	based on the company&#146;s best estimate of average royalty rates over the remaining life of each of the Cold Lake and Kearl fields, and they incorporate the Alberta government&#146;s revised oil sands royalty regime. For synthetic oil, net proved
	reserves are based on the company&#146;s best estimate of average royalty rates over the remaining life of the project, and they incorporate the Alberta government&#146;s revised oil sands royalty regime. In all cases, actual future royalty rates
	may vary with production, price and costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Net proved developed reserves are those volumes that are expected to be recovered through existing wells and facilities
	with existing equipment and operating methods or in which the cost of the required equipment is relatively minor compared to the cost of a new well or facility. Net proved undeveloped reserves are those volumes that are expected to be recovered as a
	result of future investments to drill new wells, to recomplete existing wells and/or to install facilities to collect and deliver the production from existing and future wells and facilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	No independent qualified reserves evaluator or auditor was involved in the preparation of the reserves data.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	84
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage85"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_88">
</A>
	Quarterly financial and stock trading data
</B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:14PT">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">

	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Imperial&#146;s shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange. The company&#146;s shares also trade in the United States of America on the NYSE MKT LLC. Imperial has unlisted privileges on the NYSE MKT LLC. The symbol
	on these exchanges for Imperial&#146;s common shares is IMO. Share prices were obtained from stock exchange records. U.S. dollar share price presented is based on consolidated U.S. market data.
</TD>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:16PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT COLOR="#0070C0">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_600">
</A>
	Director nominee information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The director nominee tables on the following pages provide information on the seven nominees proposed for election to the board of directors of the company. All of the
	nominees are now directors and have been since the dates indicated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Included in these tables is information relating to the director nominees&#146; biographies,
	independence status, expertise, committee memberships, attendance, public board memberships,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-profit
</FONT>
	sector affiliations and shareholdings in the company, as well as any shareholdings in Exxon Mobil
	Corporation. The information is as of February&nbsp;8, 2017, the effective date of this circular, unless otherwise indicated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For more information on our director
	nominees, please see the Statement of corporate governance practice starting on page 97.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	87
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ROWSPAN="29" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<A NAME="FIS_NAME_AND_TITLE"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;K.T.&nbsp;(Krystyna)&nbsp;Hoeg&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Voting Results of 2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Annual General Meeting:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Votes For:
</B>
	753,651,407
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(99.92%)

</B>
	638,787
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	(0.08%)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Total Votes:
</B>
	754,290,194
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Ms.&nbsp;Hoeg was the president and chief executive officer of Corby Distilleries Limited from 1996 until her retirement in February 2007. She previously held several
	positions in the finance and controllers functions of Allied Domecq PLC and Hiram Walker&nbsp;&amp; Sons Limited. Prior to that, she spent five years in public practice as a chartered accountant with the accounting firm of Touche Ross. She is
	currently a director of New Flyer Industries Inc. and is also a director of Samuel, Son&nbsp;&amp; Co. Limited and Revera Inc., privately owned corporations. Ms.&nbsp;Hoeg is also the chair of the board of the Michael Garron Hospital (formerly known
	as the Toronto East General Hospital).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Mr.&nbsp;Kruger was appointed chairman, president and chief executive officer of Imperial Oil Limited effective March&nbsp;1, 2013. Mr.&nbsp;Kruger has worked for Exxon
	Mobil Corporation and its predecessor companies since 1981 in various upstream and downstream assignments with responsibilities in the United States, the former Soviet Union, the Middle East, Africa and Southeast Asia. In his previous position,
	Mr.&nbsp;Kruger was vice-president of Exxon Mobil Corporation and president of ExxonMobil Production Company, a division of Exxon Mobil Corporation, with responsibility for ExxonMobil&#146;s global oil and gas producing operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">

	Voting Results of
	2016

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Annual General Meeting:
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Votes For:
</B>
	753,507,732 (99.90%)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Votes Withheld:
</B>
	782,462 (0.10%)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Total Votes:
</B>
	754,290,194
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Dr.&nbsp;Mintz is currently the President&#146;s Fellow at the University of Calgary&#146;s School of Public Policy focusing on tax, urban and financial market regulatory
	policy programs and also serves as the national policy advisor for EY (formerly Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young).&nbsp;From 2006 to 2015, Dr.&nbsp;Mintz was the founding Director and Palmer Chair in Public Policy for the University of Calgary, and from 1999
	to 2006, he was the president and chief executive officer of The C.D. Howe Institute. He has been a member of the board of Morneau Shepell since 2010. He has also been a professor at Queen&#146;s University Economics Department from 1978 to 1989 and
	the Joseph L. Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto from 1989 to 2007.&nbsp;Dr.&nbsp;Mintz also has published widely in the fields of public economics and fiscal federalism, has been an advisor to governments throughout the world
	on fiscal matters, and has frequently published articles in national newspapers and magazines.&nbsp;Dr.&nbsp;Mintz received the Order of Canada in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" ROWSPAN="29" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In July 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Sutherland retired as president and chief executive officer of the former IPSCO, Inc. after spending 30 years with the company and more than five
	years as president and chief executive officer. Mr.&nbsp;Sutherland is the chairman of the board of United States Steel Corporation and lead director of GATX Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Sutherland is also chairman of Graham Group Ltd., an employee owned
	corporation and is a director of Steelcraft Inc., a privately owned corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Sutherland is a former chairman of the American Iron and Steel Institute and served as a member of the board of directors of the Steel Manufacturers
	Association, the International Iron and Steel Institute, the Canadian Steel Producers Association and the National Association of Manufacturers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	27,435,855 (3.64%)

	Corporation, with responsibility for ExxonMobil&#146;s global refining and supply operations. He is located in Spring, Texas. Mr.&nbsp;Wascom has worked for ExxonMobil in a range of refining operations management assignments, as well as
	international assignments in Asia Pacific.

<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">

<B>
	Voting Results of 2016
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Annual General Meeting:
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Votes For:
</B>
	750,654,547 (99.52%)

</B>

</B>
	754,290,194
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Ms.&nbsp;Whittaker spent much of her early business career as director and partner with The Canada Consulting Group, now Boston Consulting Group. From 1989 she was
	president and chief executive officer of Canadian Satellite Communications (Cancom). In 1993, Ms.&nbsp;Whittaker joined Electronic Data Systems of Plano, Texas, then one of the world&#146;s foremost providers of information technology services.
	Initially spending several years as president and chief executive officer of EDS Canada, Ms.&nbsp;Whittaker then undertook other key leadership roles globally, ultimately serving the company as managing director, United Kingdom, Middle East and
	Africa, until her retirement from EDS in November 2005.
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

</B>
	754,290,194
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="11" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	From November 1984 until May 2001, Mr.&nbsp;Young served as chairman and chief executive officer of Fishery Products International Limited, a frozen seafood products
	company.&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Young&nbsp;is a director of McCain Foods Limited, a privately owned corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Young was appointed an Officer of the Order of Canada in 1996.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Footnotes to Director nominee tables on pages 88 through 94:
</B>
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The information includes the beneficial ownership of common shares of Imperial Oil Limited and shares of Exxon Mobil Corporation, which information not being within the knowledge of the company has been provided by the
	nominees individually.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The company&#146;s plan for restricted stock units for nonemployee directors is described on page 113. The company&#146;s plan for deferred share units for nonemployee directors is described on page 113. The
	company&#146;s plan for restricted stock units for selected employees is described on page 132.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The numbers for the company&#146;s restricted stock units represent the total of the outstanding restricted stock units received in 2010 through 2016 and deferred share units received since directors&#146; appointment.
	The numbers for Exxon Mobil Corporation restricted stock include outstanding restricted stock and restricted stock units granted under its restricted stock plan which is similar to the company&#146;s restricted stock unit plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The value for Imperial Oil Limited common shares, deferred share units and restricted stock units is based on the closing price for Imperial Oil Limited common shares on the Toronto Stock Exchange of $42.30 on
	February&nbsp;8, 2017.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The value for Exxon Mobil Corporation common shares and restricted stock is based on the closing price for Exxon Mobil Corporation common shares of $81.48 U.S., which is converted to Canadian dollars at the noon rate of
	exchange of $1.3157 provided by the Bank of Canada for February&nbsp;8, 2017.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_602">
</A>
	Majority Voting Policy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In order to better align with the Canadian Coalition for Good Governance&#146;s policy, &#147;Governance Differences of Equity Controlled Corporations&#148; &#150;
	October, 2011, in 2012, the board of directors of the company passed a resolution adopting a majority voting policy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As of the date of this circular, Exxon Mobil
	Corporation holds 69.6% of the company&#146;s shares. If Exxon Mobil Corporation&#146;s shareholdings were ever to fall below 50%, the company&#146;s policy provides that for any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-contested
</FONT>
	election of
	directors, any director nominee who receives a greater number of votes &#147;withheld&#148; from his or her election than votes &#147;for&#148; in such election shall tender his or her resignation. Within 90 days after certification of the election
	results, the board of directors will decide, through a process managed by the nominations and corporate governance committee and excluding the nominee in question, whether to accept the resignation. Absent a compelling reason for the director to
	remain on the board, the board shall accept the resignation. The board will promptly disclose its decision and, if applicable, the reasons for rejecting the tendered resignation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	95
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>

	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:14PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_605">
</A>
	Statement of corporate governance practice
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	This section provides information pertaining to our board, the committees of the board, ethics, diversity and shareholder engagement. The company is committed to high
	corporate governance standards and best practices. The company&#146;s corporate governance policies and practices comply with and in most cases exceed the requirements of
<I>
	National Instrument
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	52-110
</FONT>
	Audit
	Committees
</I>
	(NI
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	52-110),
</FONT>
<I>
	National Policy
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	58-201
</FONT>
	Corporate Governance Guidelines
</I>
	(NP
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	58-201)
</FONT>
	and
<I>
	National Instrument
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	58-101
</FONT>
	Disclosure of Corporate Governance Practices
</I>
	(NI
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	58-101).
</FONT>
	The company&#146;s common shares trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange and the NYSE MKT LLC and our
	corporate governance practices reflect the corporate governance standards of these exchanges.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_606">
</A>
	Board composition
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Composition of our director nominees:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0001193125-17-052422_G297427TXPG097.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_607">
</A>
	Tenure of our board nominees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Collectively, the seven nominees for election as directors have 71 years of experience on this company&#146;s board. The board charter provides that incumbent directors
	will not be renominated if they have attained the age of 72, except under exceptional circumstances and at the request of the chairman. The company does not have term limits for independent directors because it values the comprehensive knowledge of
	the company that long serving directors possess and independent directors are expected to remain qualified to serve for a minimum of five years. The following chart shows the current years of service of the members of the board of directors and the
	year they would normally be expected to retire from the board.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="98%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT">

<TD WIDTH="33%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
</TR>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_608">
</A>
	Skills and experience of our board nominees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	Our directors provide a wide range of skills, diversity and experience.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The current nominees for election as director collectively have experience and expertise required to ensure effective stewardship and governance of the company. The key
	areas of experience and skills along with individual involvement in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	not-for-profit
</FONT>
</FONT>
	sector for each of the nominees for election as directors can also be found in
	each of the directors tables on pages 88 through 94 of this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The table below sets out the diverse skill set required of the board and identifies the
	particular experience, qualifications, attributes, and skills of each director nominee that led the board to conclude that such person should serve as a director of the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage99"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_609">
</A>
	Independence of our board nominees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	Five out of seven of the directors are independent.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The board is composed of seven directors, the majority of whom (five out of seven) are independent. The five independent directors are not employees of the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The board determines independence on the basis of the standards specified by
<I>
	Multilateral Instrument
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	52-110
</FONT>
	Audit Committees
</I>
	(NI
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	52-110)
</FONT>
<I>
	,
</I>
	the U.S. Securities and Exchange
	Commission rules and the listing standards of the NYSE MKT LLC. The board has reviewed relevant relationships between the company and each nonemployee director and director nominee to determine compliance with these standards.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Based on the directors&#146; responses to an annual questionnaire, the board determined that none of the independent directors has any interest, business or other
	relationship that could or could reasonably be perceived to constitute a material relationship with the company. R.M. Kruger is a director and chairman, president and chief executive officer of the company and not considered to be independent. The
	board believes that the extensive knowledge of the business of the company and Exxon Mobil Corporation held by R.M. Kruger is beneficial to the other directors and his participation enhances the effectiveness of the board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	D.G. Wascom is also a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-independent
</FONT>
	director as he is an officer of Exxon Mobil Corporation. The company believes that D.G.
	Wascom, although deemed
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-independent
</FONT>
	under the relevant standards by virtue of his employment, can be viewed as independent of the company&#146;s management and that his ability to reflect the perspective
	of the company&#146;s shareholders enhances the effectiveness of the board.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="98%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="41%">
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<TR BGCOLOR="#BDD6EE" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<A NAME="FIS_NAME_AND_TITLE_6"></A>
<B>
	Name&nbsp;of&nbsp;director&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<B>
	Management&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<B>
	Independent&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Not&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	independent&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<B>
<I>
	Each committee is chaired by a different independent director and all
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	of the five independent directors are members of each committee.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_612">
</A>
	Attendance of our board nominees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	96% board and committee meeting attendance from all members.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following chart provides a summary of the attendance record of each of the directors in 2016. The attendance record of each director nominee is also set out in his
	or her biographical information on pages 88 through 94. The attendance chart also provides an overall view of the attendance per committee. Senior management directors and other members of management periodically attend committee meetings at the
	request of the committee chair.
</P>

<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_613">
</A>
	Other public company directorships of our board nominees

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	No director serves on more than two boards of another reporting issuer.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_614">
</A>
	Interlocking directorships of our board nominees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	As of the date of this proxy circular, there are no interlocking public company directorships among the director nominees listed in this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	102
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_615">
</A>
	Director qualification and selection process
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The nominations and corporate governance committee is responsible for identifying and recommending new candidates for board nomination. The committee identifies
	candidates from a number of sources, including executive search firms and referrals from existing directors. The process for selection is described in paragraph 9(a) of the Board of Directors Charter attached as Appendix A. The committee will
	consider potential future candidates as required.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In considering the qualifications of potential nominees for election as directors, the nominations and corporate
	governance committee considers the work experience and other areas of expertise of the potential nominees. The following key criteria are considered to be relevant to the work of the board of directors and its committees:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Work Experience
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Experience in leadership of businesses or other large organizations (Leadership of large organizations)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Operations/technical experience (Operations/technical)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Project management experience (Project management)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Experience in working in a global work environment (Global experience)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Experience in development of business strategy (Strategy development)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Other Expertise
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Audit committee financial expert (also see the financial expert section in the audit committee chart starting on page 106)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%">

</TD>

</TD>
