	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Expertise in financial matters (Financial expertise)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Expertise in managing relations with government (Government relations)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Experience in academia or in research (Academic/research)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Expertise in information technology (Information technology)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Expertise in executive compensation policies and practices (Executive compensation)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	With the objective of fostering a
	diversity of expertise, viewpoint and competencies, the nominations and corporate governance committee may consider the following additional factors in assessing potential nominees:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	possessing expertise in any of the following areas: law, science, marketing, administration, social/political environment or community and civic affairs;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	individual competencies in business and other areas of endeavour in contributing to the collective experience of the directors; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	providing diversity of age, gender and regional association.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:20PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The nominations and corporate governance committee
	assesses the work experience and other expertise each existing director possesses and whether each nominee is able to fill any gaps in such experience, expertise and diversity of age, gender and regional association. Consideration is also given to
	whether candidates possess the ability to contribute to the broad range of issues with which the board and its committees must deal, are able to devote the necessary amount of time to prepare for and attend board and committee meetings and are free
	of any potential legal impediment or conflict of interest. Candidates are expected to remain qualified to serve for a minimum of five years and independent directors are expected to achieve ownership of no less than 15,000 common shares, deferred
	share units and restricted share units within five years of becoming an independent director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	When the committee is recommending candidates for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-nomination,
</FONT>
	it assesses such candidates against the criteria for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-nomination
</FONT>
	as set out in paragraph 9(b) of the Board of Directors Charter found in Appendix A of this
	circular. Candidates for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	re-nomination
</FONT>
	are expected not to change their principal position, the thrust of their involvement or their regional association in a way that would significantly detract from their
	value as a director of the corporation. They are also expected to continue to be compatible with the criteria that led to their selection as nominees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	103
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage104"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_616">
</A>
	Director orientation, education and development
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The corporate secretary organizes an orientation program for all new directors. In a series of meetings over several days, new directors are briefed by staff and
	functional managers on all significant areas of the company&#146;s operations, industry specific topics, risk oversight and regulatory issues. New directors are also briefed on significant company policies, organizational structure, security,
	information technology management and on critical planning and reserves processes. They also receive key governance and disclosure documents and a comprehensive board manual which contains a record of historical information about the company,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	by-laws,
</FONT>
	company policies, the charters of the board and its committees, other relevant company business information, information on directors&#146; duties and additional board related activities and calendars.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Continuing education is provided to board and committee members through regular presentations by management which focus on providing more
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-depth
</FONT>
	information about key aspects of the business. Each year the board has an extended meeting that focuses on a particular area of the company&#146;s operations and includes a visit to one or more of the
	company&#146;s operating sites or a site of relevance to the company&#146;s operations. In September, 2016, the board visited Cold Lake, Alberta for an operations tour. The board and the committees received a number of presentations in 2016 focused
	on performance, strategy and opportunities for the business.&nbsp;Some of these continuing education events included an environmental performance review, upstream and downstream performance and improvement plans, an update on security, a retail
	assessment, an investor relations review, a review of business controls, a review of the northern Alberta wildfire impacts, a review of business line computing controls, a cybersecurity update, an update on external reporting, an emissions review, a
	competition and anti-corruption review, an oil sands review, a review of governmental relations and a review of corporate governance and regulatory issues.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Members
	of ExxonMobil&#146;s management also provide reviews of various aspects of ExxonMobil&#146;s global business.&nbsp;In 2016, the directors received presentations on ExxonMobil&#146;s information technology and cybersecurity and a presentation on
	ExxonMobil&#146;s global business overview.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Members of the board also receive an extensive package of materials prior to each board meeting that provides a
	comprehensive summary on each agenda item to be discussed. Similarly, the committee members also receive a comprehensive summary on each agenda item to be discussed by that particular committee. Informational communications and other written
	publications or reports of interest to the directors are also forwarded routinely.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The board members are canvassed as to whether there are any additional topics
	relevant to the board or to a specific committee that they would like to see addressed and management schedules presentations covering these areas.&nbsp;In addition, at every meeting the board receives an extensive update from the chairman,
	president and chief executive officer on business environment trends, relevant geopolitical activities, federal government priorities, key provincial issues and competitor activities, as appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Directors are encouraged to participate in continuing education programs and events to update their skills and knowledge.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_617">
</A>
	Board performance assessment
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The board and its
	committees, as well as the performance of the directors, are assessed on an annual basis. In 2016, the directors engaged in a performance assessment with the chairman, president and chief executive officer during which the directors evaluated the
	board and each committee&#146;s effectiveness in various areas. The chairman, president and chief executive officer also meets regularly with directors individually to discuss any outstanding issues.&nbsp;The nominations and corporate governance
	committee discussed a summary of these assessment outcomes at its January 2017 meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	104
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage105"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_618">
</A>
	Board and committee structure
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Leadership structure
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The company has chosen to combine the positions of
	chairman, president and chief executive officer. The board believes the interests of all shareholders are best served at the present time through a leadership model with a combined chairman and chief executive officer position. The company does not
	have a lead director. While the chairman of the board is not an independent director, S.D. Whittaker, chair of the executive sessions, provides leadership for the independent directors. The duties of the chair of the executive sessions include
	presiding at executive sessions of the board, and reviewing and modifying, if necessary, the agenda of the meetings of the board in advance to ensure that the board may successfully carry out its duties. The position description of the chair of the
	executive sessions is described in paragraph 8(3) of the Board of Directors Charter attached as Appendix&nbsp;A.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Independent director executive sessions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The executive sessions of the board are in camera meetings of the independent directors and are held in conjunction with every board meeting. These meetings are
	held in the absence of management. The independent directors held seven executive sessions in 2016. The purposes of the executive sessions of the board include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	raising substantive issues that are more appropriately discussed in the absence of management;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	discussing the need to communicate to the chairman of the board any matter of concern raised by any committee or director;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	addressing issues raised but not resolved at meetings of the board and assessing any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	follow-up
</FONT>
	needs with the chairman of the board;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	discussing the quality, quantity, and timeliness of the flow of information from management that is necessary for the independent directors to effectively and responsibly perform their duties, and advising the chairman
	of the board of any changes required; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	seeking feedback about board processes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	In camera sessions of the board committees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Various committees also regularly hold in camera sessions without management present. The audit committee regularly holds private sessions of the committee members as
	well as private meetings of the committee with each of the external auditor, the internal auditor and senior management as part of every regularly scheduled committee meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Committee structure
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The board has created five committees to help carry out
	its duties. Each committee is chaired by a different independent director and all of the five independent directors are members of each committee. D.G. Wascom is also a member of each committee, with the exception of the audit committee, which is
	composed entirely of independent directors. R.M. Kruger is also a member of the contributions committee. Board committees work on key issues in greater detail than would be possible at full board meetings allowing directors to more effectively
	discharge their stewardship responsibilities. The five independent chairs of the five committees are able to take a leadership role in executing the board&#146;s responsibility with respect to a specific area of the company&#146;s operations falling
	within the responsibility of the committee he or she chairs. The board and each committee have a written charter that can be found in Appendix A of this circular. The charters are reviewed and approved by the board annually. The charters set out the
	structure, position description for the chair and the process and responsibilities of that committee. There are five committees of the board.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0001193125-17-052422_G297427TXPG105.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>

	105

<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Number of
<BR>
	meetings&nbsp;in&nbsp;2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Seven meetings of the board of directors were held in 2016. There were no special meetings held this year. The independent directors hold executive sessions of the board
	in conjunction with every board meeting. These meetings are held in the absence of management. The independent directors held seven executive sessions in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<B>
	Mandate
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The board of directors is responsible for the stewardship of the corporation. The stewardship process is carried out by the board directly or through one or more of the
	committees of the board. The formal mandate of the board can be found within the Board of Directors Charter in Appendix A of this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<B>
	Highlights&nbsp;of&nbsp;2016
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Provided oversight in support of safety and environmental
	performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Regularly discussed risk management and
	business controls environment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed cyber security
	and information technology strategies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Extensively
	discussed business trends and market factors relevant to the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Regularly assessed performance of the Kearl oil sands
	operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Discussed priorities and plans associated
	with market access strategy.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed strategies and
	plans associated with
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	in-situ
</FONT>
	growth projects.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Conducted site visit to Cold Lake to review operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed extensive organizational efficiency and productivity initiatives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Regularly reviewed progress related to company owned retail
	site divestment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Role in risk
<BR>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	oversight
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The chairman, president and chief executive officer is charged with identifying, for review with the board of directors, the principal risks of the corporation&#146;s
	business, and ensuring appropriate systems are in place to manage such risks. The company&#146;s financial, execution and operational risk rests with management and the company is governed by well-established risk management systems. The board of
	directors carefully considers these risks in evaluating the company&#146;s strategic plans and specific proposals for capital expenditures and budget additions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Disclosure policy
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The company is committed to full, true and plain public disclosure of all material information in a timely manner, in order to keep security holders and the investing
	public informed about the company&#146;s operations. The full details of the corporate disclosure policy can be found on the company&#146;s internet site at
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<B>
	www.imperialoil.ca
</B>
</FONT>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Independence
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The current board of directors is composed of seven directors, the majority of whom (five out of seven) are independent. The five independent directors are not employees
	of the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:12PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Audit Committee
</B>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Number of
<BR>
	meetings in 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Six meetings of the audit committee were held in 2016. The committee members met in camera without management present at every regularly scheduled meeting and also
	separately with the internal auditor and the external auditor at all regularly scheduled meetings. A
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-audit
</FONT>
	meeting also occurs prior to every regularly scheduled audit committee meeting with the chair of
	the audit committee and the chief financial officer and both the internal and external auditors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_95"></A>
<B>
	Mandate
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The role of the audit committee includes selecting and overseeing the independent auditor, reviewing the scope and results of the audit conducted by the independent
	auditor, assisting the board in overseeing the integrity of the company&#146;s financial statements, the company&#146;s compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and the quality and effectiveness of internal controls, approving any changes
	in accounting principles and practices, and reviewing the results of monitoring activity under the company&#146;s business ethics compliance program. The formal mandate of the audit committee can be found within the Audit Committee Charter in
	Appendix A of this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Highlights of 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed the interim and full year financial and operating
	results.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed and assessed the results of the
	internal auditor&#146;s audit program.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed and
	assessed the external auditor plan, performance and fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed the committee&#146;s mandate and completed the committee self-assessment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed evolving regulations and reporting obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed business line and financial systems computing controls.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed finance plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Performed external auditor performance evaluation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.30EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Auditor independence maintained with external auditor
	managing partner rotation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Financial
<BR>
	expertise
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The
	company&#146;s board of directors has determined that K.T. Hoeg, D.S. Sutherland, S.D. Whittaker and V.L. Young meet the definition of &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148;. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has indicated that the
	designation of an audit committee financial expert does not make that person an expert for any purpose, or impose any duties, obligations or liability on that person that are greater than those imposed on members of the audit committee and board of
	directors in the absence of such designation or identification. All members of the audit committee are financially literate within the meaning of
<I>
	Multilateral Instrument
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	52-110
</FONT>
	Audit Committees
</I>
	and the
	listing standards of the NYSE MKT LLC.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Role in risk
<BR>
	oversight
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The audit committee also has an important role in risk oversight. It regularly receives updates from management on the company&#146;s risk management systems. The audit
	committee reviewed the scope of PricewaterhouseCoopers&#146; audit in light of risks associated with the energy industry, the regulatory environment and company-specific financial audit risks. The committee reviews financial statements and internal
	and external audit results. It oversees risks associated with financial and accounting matters, including compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, and the company&#146;s financial reporting and internal controls systems.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Independence
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The audit
	committee is composed entirely of independent directors. All members met board approved independence standards, as that term is defined in
<I>
	Multilateral Instrument
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	52-110
</FONT>
	Audit Committees
</I>
	, the U.S.
	Securities and Exchange Commission rules and the listing standards of the NYSE MKT LLC.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:12PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" COLSPAN="5" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT" BGCOLOR="#BDD6EE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Executive Resources Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Committee
<BR>
	members
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;K.T. Hoeg (chair)
</P>

	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;V.L. Young (vice-chair)

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">

</TD>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.40EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	None of the members of the executive resources committee currently serves as a chief executive officer of another company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_96"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Number of
<BR>
	meetings in
	2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
	Seven meetings of the executive resources committee were held in 2016.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Mandate
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The executive resources committee is responsible for corporate policy on compensation and for specific decisions on the compensation of the chief executive officer and
	key senior executives and officers reporting directly to that position. In addition to compensation matters, the committee is also responsible for succession plans and appointments to senior executive and officer positions, including the chief
	executive officer. The formal mandate of the executive resources committee can be found within the Executive Resources Committee Charter in Appendix A of this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	107
</P>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_97"></A>
<B>
	Highlights of 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed executive compensation program and principles.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Approved longer restricted stock unit forfeiture
	periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Appointment of three officers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Continued focus on succession planning for senior management
	positions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_98"></A>
<B>
	Committee
<BR>
	members relevant
<BR>
	skills and
<BR>
	experience
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Ms.&nbsp;Hoeg, Ms.&nbsp;Whittaker, Mr.&nbsp;Wascom, Mr.&nbsp;Sutherland and Mr.&nbsp;Young had extensive and lengthy experience in managing and implementing their
	respective companies&#146; compensation policies and practices in their past role as chief executive officers or members of senior management. Ms.&nbsp;Hoeg, Dr.&nbsp;Mintz, Mr.&nbsp;Sutherland and Ms.&nbsp;Whittaker sit or have sat on compensation
	committees of one or more public companies. Accordingly, committee members are able to use this experience and knowledge derived from their roles with other companies in judging the suitability of the company&#146;s compensation policies and
	practices.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Role in risk
<BR>
	oversight
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The executive
	resources committee oversees the compensation programs and practices that are designed to encourage appropriate risk assessment and risk management.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Independence
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The members of the executive resources committee are independent, with the exception of D.G. Wascom, who is not considered to be independent under the rules of the U.S.
	Securities and Exchange Commission, Canadian securities rules and the rules of the NYSE MKT LLC due to his employment with Exxon Mobil Corporation. However, the Canadian Coalition for Good Governance&#146;s policy, &#147;Governance Differences of
	Equity Controlled Corporations&#148; &#150; October, 2011, would view Mr.&nbsp;Wascom as a related director and independent of management and who may participate as a member of the company&#146;s executive resources committee. Mr.&nbsp;Wascom&#146;s
	participation helps to ensure an objective process for determining compensation of the company&#146;s officers and directors and assists the deliberations of this committee by bringing the views and perspectives of the majority shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;S.D. Whittaker
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;V.L. Young
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Number of
<BR>
	meetings in 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Three
	meetings of the environment, health and safety committee were held in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Mandate
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The role of the environment, health and safety committee is to review and monitor the company&#146;s policies and practices in matters of the environment, health and
	safety and to monitor the company&#146;s compliance with legislative, regulatory and corporate standards in these areas. The committee monitors trends and reviews current and emerging public policy in this area. The formal mandate of the
	environment, health and safety committee can be found within the Environment, Health and Safety Committee Charter in Appendix A of this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Highlights in 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Personnel and process safety review.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Emission and environmental incident review.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Operations integrity management system review.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Alberta and Ontario climate change regulations review.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Role in risk
<BR>
	oversight
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The environment, health and safety committee reviews and monitors the company&#146;s policies and practices in matters of environment, health and safety, which policies
	and practices are intended to mitigate and manage risk in these areas. The committee receives regular reports from management on these matters.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Independence
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The members of the environment, health and safety committee are independent, with the exception of D.G. Wascom.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Number of
<BR>
	meetings in
	2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Four meetings of the nominations and corporate governance committee were held in 2016.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Mandate
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The role of the nominations and corporate governance
	committee is to oversee issues of corporate governance as they apply to the company, including the overall performance of the board, review potential nominees for directorship and review the charters of the board and any of its committees. The
	formal mandate of the nominations and corporate governance committee can be found within the Nominations and Corporate Governance Committee Charter in Appendix A of this circular.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Highlights in 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed and recommended change to compensation paid to
	nonemployee directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Approved statement of corporate
	governance practices.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Completion of board and committee
	self-assessment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Review of board and committee
	charters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Board succession planning.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Received updates highlighting key Canadian, US and
	international governance and regulatory developments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:2PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Role in risk
<BR>
	oversight
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The nominations and corporate governance committee oversees risk by implementing an effective program for corporate governance, including board
	composition and succession planning.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Independence
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:0.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The members of the nominations and corporate governance committee are independent, with the exception of D.G. Wascom, who is not considered to be
	independent under the rules of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, Canadian securities rules and the rules of the NYSE MKT LLC due to his employment with Exxon Mobil Corporation. However, the Canadian Coalition for Good Governance&#146;s
	policy, &#147;Governance Differences of Equity Controlled Corporations&#148; &#150; October, 2011, would view Mr.&nbsp;Wascom as a related director and independent of management and who may participate as a member of the company&#146;s nominations
	and corporate governance committee. Mr.&nbsp;Wascom&#146;s participation helps to ensure an objective nominations process and assists the deliberations of this committee by bringing the views and perspectives of the majority shareholder.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:12PT">

	Three meetings of the contributions committee were held in 2016.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Mandate
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The role of the contributions committee is to oversee all of the company&#146;s community investment activities, including charitable donations which are presently made
	through the Imperial Oil Foundation. The formal mandate of the contributions committee can be found within the Contributions Committee Charter in Appendix A of this circular.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Highlights in 2016
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Reviewed London Benchmarking Standards (LBG) assessment
	showing Imperial&#146;s overall value to the community of $27&nbsp;million due to continued investment in research and further improvement to program management costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Contributed $4.2&nbsp;million in 2016 to support
	Imperial&#146;s United Way partners across Canada.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Took
	steps to reduce administration costs and simplify the process for community partners to apply for funding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:2.50EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.50EM; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#9679;
</FONT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Supported Fort McMurrary fire response effort with $100&nbsp;thousand of direct funding and ongoing support of Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo organizations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID ; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:9PT">
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<B>
	Independence
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-RIGHT:2PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The majority of the members of the contributions committee are independent (five out of seven) with the exception of R.M. Kruger and D.G. Wascom.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	109
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:13PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<A NAME="D297427D10K_HTM_TX297427_619">
</A>
	Board of director compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:12PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Director compensation discussion and analysis
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:8PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	Changes to
	directors&#146; compensation in July 2016 better align the long-term
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT COLOR="#0066B3">
<B>
<I>
	financial interests of the directors
	with those of the shareholders
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:6.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:6.00PT SOLID #5B9BD5">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:14PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/23/0001193125-17-052422_G297427TXPG110.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Nonemployee director compensation levels are reviewed by the nominations and corporate governance committee each year, and resulting
	recommendations are presented to the full board for approval. The nominations and corporate governance committee decided not to use an external research firm to assemble the comparator data to determine compensation for the July&nbsp;1, 2016 - June
	30, 2017 period. The committee relied instead on an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	internally-led
</FONT>
	assessment to provide competitive compensation and market data for directors&#146; compensation, which assisted the committee in making a
	compensation recommendation for the company&#146;s directors. The internal assessment maintained the compensation design philosophy, objectives and principles and was consistent with previous methodology used in this analysis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Employees of the company or Exxon Mobil Corporation receive no extra pay for serving as directors. Nonemployee directors receive compensation consisting of cash and
	restricted stock units. Since 1999, the nonemployee directors have been able to receive all or part of their cash directors&#146; fees in the form of deferred share units. The purpose of the deferred share unit plan for nonemployee directors is to
	provide them with additional motivation to promote sustained improvement in the company&#146;s business performance and shareholder value by allowing them to have all or part of their directors&#146; fees tied to the future growth in value of the
	company&#146;s common shares. The deferred share unit plan is described in more detail on page 113.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	110
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Compensation decision making process and considerations
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The nominations and corporate governance committee relies on market comparisons with a group of 21 major Canadian companies with national and international scope and
	complexity. The company draws its nonemployee directors from a wide variety of industrial sectors and, as such, a broad sample is appropriate for this purpose. The nominations and corporate governance committee does not target any specific
	percentile among comparator companies at which to align compensation for this group. The 21 comparator companies included in the benchmark sample are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="50%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%">
</TD>
</TR>

<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PX SOLID #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1PX SOLID #000000; PADDING-LEFT:8PT">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Royal Bank of Canada
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Hedging policy
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	Company policy prohibits all
	employees, including executives, and directors, from purchasing or selling puts, calls, other options or futures contracts on the company or Exxon Mobil Corporation stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:16PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	For a discussion on the process by which the compensation of the company&#146;s executive officers is determined, see the Compensation discussion and analysis section
	starting on page 126.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	111
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Director compensation details and tables
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:14PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:11PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
	Compensation details
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Board and Committee Retainer
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The compensation of the nonemployee directors is assessed annually. Effective July&nbsp;1, 2015, the annual retainer for board memberships was $110,000 per year. The
	nonemployee directors were also paid $20,000 for membership on all board committees. Additionally, each board committee chair received a retainer of $10,000 for each committee chaired. Nonemployee directors were not paid a fee for attending board
	and committee meetings for each of the seven regularly-scheduled meetings. However, they were eligible to receive a fee of $2,000 per board or committee meeting occurring on any other day. There were no other meetings that occurred outside of the
	regularly-scheduled meeting dates eligible for this additional fee payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In July 2016, the nominations and corporate governance committee recommended, and the
	board subsequently approved, a change in the compensation paid to the nonemployee directors to better align the long-term financial interests of the directors with those of the shareholders. Effective July&nbsp;1, 2016, the nonemployee directors
	received an annual retainer for board membership of $110,000 per year and each board committee chair also received a retainer of $10,000 for each committee chaired. Effective July&nbsp;1, 2016, the committee membership retainer and the fee for
	meetings that occur outside of the regularly-scheduled meeting dates were eliminated. The grant of restricted stock units was also increased for 2016 as discussed below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table summarizes the changes that occurred to the director compensation terms in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL; FONT-SIZE:8PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR STYLE = "PAGE-BREAK-INSIDE:AVOID">
<TD WIDTH="3%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The nonemployee directors may elect to take all or a portion of the cash retainer in the form of deferred share units.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:9PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" ALIGN="CENTER">
	112
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage113"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D297427D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Equity based compensation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
<B>
<I>
	Deferred share units
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	In 1999, an additional form of long-term
	incentive compensation (&#147;deferred share units&#148;) was made available to nonemployee directors. Nonemployee directors may elect to receive all or a portion of their cash compensation in the form of deferred share units.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL">
	The following table shows the portion of the retainer each nonemployee director elected to receive in cash and deferred share units in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
